intro: Memecylon longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and arranged in clusters, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
